comment: If ` A ` is a limit point of the filter ` F ` , then all the points which specialize ` A ` (in the specialization preorder) are also limit points. Thus, the set of limit points is a union of closed sets (although this is only nontrivial for non-T1 spaces). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Sep-2015.)
